$interpreted: Cautious Kidnapper: How's the princess?
Irritable Kidnapper: Fed and watered. Nothing else to say.
Irritable Kidnapper: It's been three days, when is master taking her away?
Cautious Kidnapper: He said he'll send someone once the dust settles.
Cautious Kidnapper: Then our mission will be complete.
Naya: Complete?! More like compromised!
Irritable Kidnapper: Castle crooks?! How did you get in here?
Sione: We almost passed right on by, but the princess left us a gift -- her gemstone necklace.
Sione: That's how we found you!
Cautious Kidnapper: I'll be damned! When did that broad...
Naya: Been tirelessly searching for three days and three nights,
Naya: and it's time for payback! Bring Her Highness out!
Irritable Kidnapper: It's just two chicks...get the others out here and we'll round them up!
Naya: These "chicks" are about to serve you up a nice, fat beating..
Naya: Sione, the princess has been found!
Sione: Your Highness, are you alright?
Angelia: Yes...I'm fine...
Naya: You've got a lot of nerve kidnapping the Kingdom's princess! You might have guts but you have no idea what you're doing!
Sione: They don't seem like common kidnappers. I think the real culprit is still at large.
Angelia: The coin sacks they carry...they were made of silk fabrics from the castle...
Naya: WHAT? You mean that specially made cloth that's gifted only to nobles?
Naya: It's a symbol of status. Even I don't own such luxurious material. How did you get your hands on such fabric?!
Irritable Kidnapper: Hmph! Nice try, but I ain't talking. You won't get an answer from me!
Sione: …Looks like we got to do this the hard way.
Naya: Your Higness, let's take a rest.
Angelia: Eh? Oh, ok...
Irritable Kidnapper: Wait, wait...what are you doing? Stay back!
Irritable Kidnapper: AAHHH! I meant, master gave it to us!
Cautious Kidnapper: He always in disguise everytime I see him...I've never seen his face, I SWEAR!
Irritable Kidnapper: AHHHH! Why don't you just kill me already?!
Naya: Dear Sione, have we learned who's behind the kidnapping?
Sione: I've used Colonel Dylan's torture methods, but he hasn't said a word.
Sione: He doesn't know.
Angelia: Uh... what torture methods?
Sione: Your Highness...mundane matters like these, it's best you not know.
Naya: Is this the coin sack Your Highness mentioned?
Naya: What a waste. Got their hands on such expensive fabric and didn't even use it for clothes or curtains. A coin sack? What terrible taste.
Sione: It's filled with precious crystals. Whoever this master is...they must be of great importance...
Angelia: We import few silks from the East Alliance every year. They're kept under lock and key...only a noble could be responsible.
Angelia: It's safe to assume that the one behind my kidnapping has access to castle grounds...
Naya: Damn! The nerve! We need to head back and inform King Theodore, to rat out whoever's responsible!

Sione: That won't do. Word of the princess being saved cannot be made known to the castle.
Especially not to His Majesty King Theodore.
Angelia: Why?
Sione: Er... if the noble is a frequent visitor of the castle, the risk upon our return is too high.
Angelia: True. We still don't know who the enemy is...Sione, what do you think?
Sione: Em... I suggest that before the culprit is found, Your Highness should hide in a safe place.
Naya: But where to hide? Every noble is a suspect.
Naya: That means nowhere in Kingdom of the Sun is safe?
Angelia: With the Sunshine Infantry?
Sione: That won't do. To investigate the kidnapping, some castle folk have already paid a visit to the Infantry.
Sione: They can't be trusted.
Naya: What a headache...
Angelia: I've got it! I'll hide in the Slums!
Naya: The Slums! But that's near the castle?
Angelia: But no noble would ever step foot in the Slums, and the culprit wouldn't think of there as a hiding spot fit for a princess.
Sione: Makes sense. The Slums are actually the safest for now. Naya, please escort the princess.
Naya: Sione, you're is not coming?
Sione: Should I suddenly vanish, my superiors might notice.
Naya: Right... you can count on me.
Naya: Nobody will suspect me. I can move between the Prairie and Slums with ease, thanks to my rank.

Sione: I'm turning these kidnappers in to Colonel Levon.
We'll investigate the matter together.
Sione: Naya, please protect the princess.
Naya: I won't let you down!
Angelia: Sione, be careful out there.
Sione: You too, Your Highness.
Naya: Princess, it's time to go!
Sione: Could Colonel Dylan have been right about the identity of the culprit...?

Model.Text: How's the princess?
Fed and watered. Nothing else to say.
It's been three days, when is master taking her away?
He said he'll send someone once the dust settles.
Then our mission will be complete.
Complete?! More like compromised!
Castle crooks?! How did you get in here?
We almost passed right on by, but the princess left us a gift -- her gemstone necklace.
That's how we found you!
I'll be damned! When did that broad...
Been tirelessly searching for three days and three nights,
and it's time for payback! Bring Her Highness out!
It's just two chicks...get the others out here and we'll round them up!
These "chicks" are about to serve you up a nice, fat beating..
Sione, the princess has been found!
Your Highness, are you alright?
Yes...I'm fine...
You've got a lot of nerve kidnapping the Kingdom's princess! You might have guts but you have no idea what you're doing!
They don't seem like common kidnappers. I think the real culprit is still at large.
The coin sacks they carry...they were made of silk fabrics from the castle...
WHAT? You mean that specially made cloth that's gifted only to nobles?
It's a symbol of status. Even I don't own such luxurious material. How did you get your hands on such fabric?!
Hmph! Nice try, but I ain't talking. You won't get an answer from me!
…Looks like we got to do this the hard way.
Your Higness, let's take a rest.
Eh? Oh, ok...
Wait, wait...what are you doing? Stay back!
AAHHH! I meant, master gave it to us!
He always in disguise everytime I see him...I've never seen his face, I SWEAR!
AHHHH! Why don't you just kill me already?!
Dear Sione, have we learned who's behind the kidnapping?
I've used Colonel Dylan's torture methods, but he hasn't said a word.
He doesn't know.
Uh... what torture methods?
Your Highness...mundane matters like these, it's best you not know.
Is this the coin sack Your Highness mentioned?
What a waste. Got their hands on such expensive fabric and didn't even use it for clothes or curtains. A coin sack? What terrible taste.
It's filled with precious crystals. Whoever this master is...they must be of great importance...
We import few silks from the East Alliance every year. They're kept under lock and key...only a noble could be responsible.
It's safe to assume that the one behind my kidnapping has access to castle grounds...
Damn! The nerve! We need to head back and inform King Theodore, to rat out whoever's responsible!

That won't do. Word of the princess being saved cannot be made known to the castle.
Especially not to His Majesty King Theodore.
Why?
Er... if the noble is a frequent visitor of the castle, the risk upon our return is too high.
True. We still don't know who the enemy is...Sione, what do you think?
Em... I suggest that before the culprit is found, Your Highness should hide in a safe place.
But where to hide? Every noble is a suspect.
That means nowhere in Kingdom of the Sun is safe?
With the Sunshine Infantry?
That won't do. To investigate the kidnapping, some castle folk have already paid a visit to the Infantry.
They can't be trusted.
What a headache...
I've got it! I'll hide in the Slums!
The Slums! But that's near the castle?
But no noble would ever step foot in the Slums, and the culprit wouldn't think of there as a hiding spot fit for a princess.
Makes sense. The Slums are actually the safest for now. Naya, please escort the princess.
Sione, you're is not coming?
Should I suddenly vanish, my superiors might notice.
Right... you can count on me.
Nobody will suspect me. I can move between the Prairie and Slums with ease, thanks to my rank.

I'm turning these kidnappers in to Colonel Levon.
We'll investigate the matter together.
Naya, please protect the princess.
I won't let you down!
Sione, be careful out there.
You too, Your Highness.
Princess, it's time to go!
Could Colonel Dylan have been right about the identity of the culprit...?

I can move between the Prairie and Slums with ease, thanks to my rank.","sfxName":"h0018_story_011","sfxVolume":1.0},{"ID":"main_004_001_dialog_english##_12_008","SpeakerName":"Sione","SpeakerAssetName":"CharacterName/h0020","IconName":"h0020s4_serious","IconLocate":2,"Text":"I'm turning these kidnappers in to Colonel Levon.\nWe'll investigate the matter together.","sfxName":"h0020_story_012","sfxVolume":1.0},{"ID":"main_004_001_dialog_english##_12_009","SpeakerName":"Sione","SpeakerAssetName":"CharacterName/h0020","IconName":"h0020s4_serious","IconLocate":2,"Text":"Naya, please protect the princess.","sfxName":"h0020_story_021","sfxVolume":1.0},{"ID":"main_004_001_dialog_english##_13_000","SpeakerName":"Naya","SpeakerAssetName":"CharacterName/h0018","IconName":"h0018s3_happiness","IconLocate":2,"Text":"I won't let you down!","sfxName":"h0018_story_019","sfxVolume":1.0},{"ID":"main_004_001_dialog_english##_13_001","SpeakerName":"Angelia","SpeakerAssetName":"CharacterName/h0021","IconName":"h0021s4_serious","IconLocate":2,"Text":"Sione, be careful out there.","sfxName":"h0021_story_021","sfxVolume":1.0},{"ID":"main_004_001_dialog_english##_13_002","SpeakerName":"Sione","SpeakerAssetName":"CharacterName/h0020","IconName":"h0020s4_happiness","IconLocate":2,"Text":"You too, Your Highness.","sfxName":"h0020_story_014","sfxVolume":1.0},{"ID":"main_004_001_dialog_english##_13_003","SpeakerName":"Naya","SpeakerAssetName":"CharacterName/h0018","IconName":"h0018s3_happiness","IconLocate":2,"Text":"Princess, it's time to go!","sfxName":"h0018_story_027","sfxVolume":1.0},{"ID":"main_004_001_dialog_english##_14_000","SpeakerName":"Sione","SpeakerAssetName":"CharacterName/h0020","IconName":"h0020s4_serious","IconLocate":2,"Text":"Could Colonel Dylan have been right about the identity of the culprit...?","sfxName":"h0020_story_013","sfxVolume":1.0}]}
